results.content:
I believe that Manish has done an excellent job with this course, to list few wins 
> Very well organized structure to help learn Apex development
> Simple and effective ways of explaining content with animation
> Hands on, and explaining with examples
> Good way of introducing to SF documentation while working on examples

The reason I did not give 5 stars was
> Would have been good if LWC was also covered (well there is a diff course for just that), but as the Name of the course goes, people would expect that
> One of the Q&A questions requests for more SOQL queries exercises, but haven't seen any update yet.
> some more advanced topics such as save order, better debugging techniques would make this even more awesome.

Great work Manish!
results.content_html:
I believe that Manish has done an excellent job with this course, to list few wins
> Very well organized structure to help learn Apex development
> Simple and effective ways of explaining content with animation
> Hands on, and explaining with examples
> Good way of introducing to SF documentation while working on examples

The reason I did not give 5 stars was
> Would have been good if LWC was also covered (well there is a diff course for just that), but as the Name of the course goes, people would expect that
> One of the Q&A questions requests for more SOQL queries exercises, but haven't seen any update yet.
> some more advanced topics such as save order, better debugging techniques would make this even more awesome.

Great work Manish!

results.content:
This is probably the best course I have ever taken. It is quite unbelievable how much Manish has packed in one course. I just kept going on one video after another and doing all the challenges.

It was very well presented. Manish clearly knows the topic really well and loves to teach. I think every developer/would be developer should take this course irrespective of the language he wants to learn. I learned so much from one course.

I come from SAP background and a reasonably proficient in coding. I think I would have struggled if I didn't have programming background. That is my only suggestion for improving this course. Please increase the exercises/challenges so that non-developers can practice more on every topic.
results.content_html:
This is probably the best course I have ever taken. It is quite unbelievable how much Manish has packed in one course. I just kept going on one video after another and doing all the challenges.

It was very well presented. Manish clearly knows the topic really well and loves to teach. I think every developer/would be developer should take this course irrespective of the language he wants to learn. I learned so much from one course.

I come from SAP background and a reasonably proficient in coding. I think I would have struggled if I didn't have programming background. That is my only suggestion for improving this course. Please increase the exercises/challenges so that non-developers can practice more on every topic.

results.content: Without a doubt one of the best if not the best course I have taken on Udemy. Manish goes through all the concepts very clearly and gives challenges to complete which is very helpful when you are trying to learn the topics. Some are not easy at all especially as I am not from a development background but Manish breaks them down in a simple way and provides challenges to reinforce your knowledge. Manish is incredibly diligent and continues to add more videos when needed. He also responds to Q&A very quickly which is great. Highly recommend.

results.content: Overall its good a course. Much effort invested to breakdown things into easy to understand chunks. But it could be better. results.content: Very good hands on course on subject of APEX. The instructor even promises to add more content to make it a complete dev course. My suggestion is to add Apex Integration Services to make it truly complete. Esp. REST/SOAP Callouts as currently the course ends around Async. Overall thumbs up to Manish, and I promise to add the one more star once the Apex Integration is added. Cheers!

My suggestion is to add Apex Integration Services to make it truly complete. Esp. REST/SOAP Callouts as currently the course ends around Async. Overall thumbs up to Manish, and I promise to add the one more star once the Apex Integration is added. Cheers!
